poem:
The Love Dragon

In forest deep, by water's gleam,  
love's soft-footed guardian roams.  
His presence mosses the silence,  
distracts the fear of snapping claws.  
In white's bright flash, a bond ignites,  
calls through the darkened canopy –  
Heart's fierce bark, fur's gentle brush,  
saving breath in the wild's chorus.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "‘I think I’m about to die, then I see a white flash and Henry is on the bear’s back’: the hero dogs who save lives In August 2014, conservation biologist Steve Krichbaum was searching for wood turtles on a small plateau in a West Virginia forest. His dog Henry was exploring below, near a stream, out of sight. Henry – a fluffy former stray so joyfully affectionate Krichbaum’s former partner nicknamed him the “Love Dragon”". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
